column4: Shareholder activism grows overseas as US market gets crowded
column5: NEW YORK/LONDON  Aug 31 Activist hedge funds have launched more non-U.S. campaigns this year than any year since the financial crisis  as managers slowly expand overseas in the face of a more challenging market at home.

column4: RPT - INSIGHT-Boeing uses its clout to control supplier consolidation
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 30 Berkshire Hathaway Inc's  $37 billion deal for aerospace supplier Precision Castparts Corp is encouraging investors to consolidate the fragmented aircraft components industry  even as Boeing Co  uses its clout as the world's biggest plane maker to put a check on some deals.

column4: Bristol-Myers buys rights to acquire fibrosis drug developer
column5: Drugmaker Bristol-Myers Squibb said it bought rights to a mid-stage fibrosis drug and its privately held developer for up to $1.25 billion  boosting its pipeline for drugs that treat tissue scarring.

column4: UPDATE 1-Bristol-Myers buys rights to acquire fibrosis drug developer

column4: Bristol-Myers buys rights to fibrosis drug for up to $1.25 bln
column5: Aug 31 Drugmaker Bristol-Myers Squibb  said it would buy the worldwide rights to a mid-stage fibrosis drug from privately held Promedior Inc for up to $1.25 billion.

column4: Chipotle sued over GMO-free menu claims
column5: Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc's new GMO-free menu claims have lured diners and boosted the burrito chain's stock price  but it has some consumers crying foul.

column4: Eni's credentials boosted by giant gas find in Egypt
column5: MILAN Eni's "supergiant" gas find off the coast of Egypt bolsters its top-flight exploration credentials and gives the Italian energy group access to easy reserves that fit its strategy of seeking growth without sacrificing dividends.

column4: European shares slide to worst monthly performance since August 2011
column5: LONDON  Aug 31 European shares suffered their worst monthly performance in four years on Monday  as concerns over a Chinese economic slowdown and a possible U.S. interest rate rise hit the region's stock markets.

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 2-Italy's Eni makes mega gas discovery off Egyptian coast
column5: ROME/MILAN  Aug 30 Italian energy group Eni  said on Sunday it had discovered the largest known gas field in the Mediterranean off the Egyptian coast  predicting the find could help meet Egypt's gas needs for decades to come.

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Eni open to selling stake in supergiant Egypt gas find
column5: MILAN  Aug 31 Italy's Eni is open to selling a stake in its "supergiant" Zohr gas field discovery off of Egypt  its chief executive said  as the state-controlled energy company looks for funds to bankroll development without sacrificing dividends.

column4: European shares drop lower  set for weakest month since August 2011
column5: LONDON  Aug 31 European shares fell on Monday  with Germany's DAX and France's CAC on track for their weakest month for four years  hit by sliding Chinese stocks and prospects of a near-term U.S. interest rate increase.

column4: Initial investment in Eni mega gas field in Egypt about $3.5 billion: EGAS

column4: XTO Energy well in North Dakota suffers blowout  leaks 550 barrels
column5: A North Dakota oil well owned by Exxon Mobil subsidiary XTO Energy blew out on Saturday  leaking more than 550 barrels (23 100 gallons) of crude  some of which left the wellpad and seeped into surrounding grasses.

column5: MILAN  Aug 31 It would be "unconscionable" for Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCA) not to pursue a merger with rival General Motors and create a company that can generate $30 billion a year in cash  FCA chief Sergio Marchionne said in a newspaper interview.

column4: India cenbank names SBI  ICICI as 'systemically important' lenders
column5: MUMBAI  Aug 31 India's central bank listed State Bank of India and ICICI Bank as the country's two "systemically important banks"  lining them up for tougher supervision to avoid collapses that would rattle the financial system and economy.

column4: REFILE-Kellogg's S.African unit opposes rivals cereal merger
column5: CAPE TOWN  Aug 31 Kellogg's South African unit will urge competition authorities to block a proposed merger between rivals Pioneer Foods and Futurelife  regulators said on Monday.

column5: WASHINGTON Lockheed Martin Corp has won a contract worth $431 million to provide support equipment and services for the ninth batch of F-35 fighter jets  the Pentagon announced Monday.

column4: Poland's PGE confirms H1 net loss of $1.34 bln
column5: WARSAW  Aug 31 Poland's biggest power producer PGE posted a net loss of 5.06 billion zlotys ($1.34 billion) in the first half of 2015 because of the 8.8 billion zlotys impairment charge it announced last week  the company said late on Monday.
